data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You always want to look in the direction you are going. Follow these instructions and you will always be facing forward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn right after turning around, you must first turn right to turn around again. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around, you have to take 10 steps. If you take 6 steps, you take 6 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It is a complete intruction to take 7 steps. One-step is the same as one step. One step is the same as 1 step. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 5 steps back to start at 10 steps. Turning left 3 steps and going down 3 steps leads to going down 3 steps and going back around. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 7 steps to turn around. Take the steps and turn around again. Take the steps and turn around once more. So, the answer is No.

Turn right. Take 8 steps.Take 9 steps. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

You take 2 steps to return with 6 steps to turn around and 8 steps to turn around. You take 2 steps to return with 8 steps to turn around and 2 steps to take the second step. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you face forward you always take 1 step forward and take 4 steps forward. If you take 1 step left and take 4 steps forward you take 4 steps and take 6 steps forward. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you have just turned around, you take 2 steps to take 2 steps back. The instructions say if you take 2 steps back, then you take 2 steps and 5 more steps back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, it always means you will take 3 steps forward. If you would like to go backward, you would have to take one step backward. If you would like to go forward, it would mean you will take 3 steps forward. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you’re looking forward in the direction of travel, if you are facing backward, you will always face forward if you are facing forward. If you are facing right, and you are facing backward in the direction of travel, you will always take left. If your starting point is right-handed, you must always take right. So, the answer is Yes.

It is always forward to face forward. One can only take one step backward. Thus, the answer is yes.

You always must face forward. When facing forward, every time you take a step, always take 3 steps forward to get back to the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.

Once you return to the starting point, you always face forward. In order to return to the starting point, you must return forward. So, the answer is yes.

Inversely, if you take 10 steps right, you can only return to the beginning point. There are no steps backward, so it makes sense that you take 10 steps right. The setting instructions say you only need to take 10 steps right. So, the answer is no.

A person always faces forward and is always taking a forward step. They can not always face backward and invariably take a backward step. So, the answer is No.

If 1 step backward is taken, you come back the same way you started. Step 1: Take 5 steps left. Step 2: Take 4 steps right. Step 3: Take 1 step backward. Step 4: Take 4 steps right. Step 5: Take 5 steps left. Step 6: Take 6 steps left. So, the answer is No.

You always start with your face forward. You do not make any change to your face. When you go forward, you do so towards the center of the building with your right foot on the far right step, your left foot on the far left step, and your right foot on the close left step. While facing all directions, your forward foot should always be facing forward from your starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.

The following equation is the same whether you always face forward or not. With a x y coordinate system you always take 6 steps right and take 9 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward when you move, you always take the next two steps. If you move left and backward, you always take 5 steps backward. Similarly, if you move forward and take 2 steps forward, you always take 2 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

You can’t return to a starting point that you started from. You can’t take 10 steps backward and 8 steps backward, both of which are a combination of 2 actions to take backward, 7 steps right and 7 steps forward. So, the answer is no.

The steps forward and backward consists of 4 steps. If the starting point is facing forward and you are facing forward the first step would be 1 - 4 steps. The answer: Yes.
